translation: How can we believe it?'

translation: The sage answered, 'I cultivate patience.'

translation: The king then pulled out his sword and said to him, 'If you tolerate humility, I want to test you, knowing if you can tolerate it.'

translation: He then cut off his two hands and asked the sage, saying, 'I'll tolerate it.'

translation: Again, he cut off his two feet and asked again, saying, 'I'll tolerate it.'

translation: The next step was to cut off his ears and nose, but his appearance remained the same as that of a bearer.

source_sentence: 爾時天地，六種震動。
translation: At that time heaven and earth shook in six ways.

source_sentence: 時仙人五百弟子，飛於虛空，而問師言：『被如是苦，忍辱之心，不忘失耶？』
translation: The five hundred disciples of the sage then flew up into space and asked their teacher, 'Have you not forgotten this kind of suffering with patience and humility?'

source_sentence: 其師答言：『心未變易。』
translation: The teacher answered, 'The mind hasn't changed.'

source_sentence: 王乃驚愕，復更問言：『汝云忍辱，以何為證？』
translation: The king was startled and asked again, 'You say forbearance, but what's the way to prove it?'

source_sentence: 仙人答曰：『我若實忍，至誠不虛，血當為乳，身當還復。』
translation: The sage answered, 'If I truly tolerate it and sincerely don't lie, my blood will become milk, and my body will return.'

source_sentence: 其言已訖，血尋成乳，平完如故。
translation: After he finished speaking, his blood dissolved into milk and remained even as before.

translation: Seeing this forbearance, the king was overcome with fear and said, 'Duh, I have no form!'

translation: They disparage the great sage, but they've only shown compassion and accepted my repentance.'

translation: The holy man said, “If you cut off my body with a sword in the form of a woman, I tolerate it as if on the ground.

translation: Later, when I become a buddha, I'll first use the sword of wisdom to cut off your three poisons.'

source_sentence: 爾時山中，諸龍鬼神，見迦梨王抂忍辱仙人，各懷懊惱，興大雲霧，雷電霹靂，
translation: At that time all the dragons and ghosts in the mountain saw the royal sage Kālīputra, who was ashamed of his humility. Being distressed, they each produced great clouds and mist, thunder and lightning.

source_sentence: 欲害彼王，及其眷屬。
translation: They want to harm that king and his retinue.

source_sentence: 時仙人仰語：『若為我者，莫苦傷害。』
translation: The sage then looked up and said, 'If you do this for me, don't harm me.'

translation: After repenting, the king of Kāli always invited the sage to his palace to make offerings.

source_sentence: 爾時有異梵志，徒眾千人，見王敬待羼提波梨，甚懷妬忌，於其屏處，
translation: At that time some heretical brahmans, accompanied by a thousand disciples, saw the king paying respect to Kaṇṭipāriputra and became very jealous of him.

source_sentence: 坐以塵土糞穢，而以坌之。
translation: He sat cross-legged because of the filthy dirt of dust and dirt he collected.

source_sentence: 爾時仙人，見其如是，即時立誓：『我今修忍，為於群生，積行不休，
translation: Seeing him like this, the holy man immediately made a vow: Now I cultivate patience and never stop practicing it for the sake of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 後會成佛。
translation: Later, he'll become a buddha.

source_sentence: 若佛道成，先以法水，洗汝塵垢，除汝欲穢，永令清淨。』」
translation: If the Buddha's path is accomplished, he first uses the water of the Dharma to wash away all your dirt and defilements with it, removing your desires and making them permanently pure.'

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「欲知爾時羼提波梨者，則我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the monk, If you want to know that I am Kārttikapālī at that point, then I am myself.

source_sentence: 時王迦梨及四大臣，今憍陳如等五比丘是。
translation: At the time, King Kālīya and the four ministers, these five monks were Kauṇḍinya and so forth.

source_sentence: 時千梵志塵坌我者，今欝卑羅等千比丘是。
translation: A thousand priests then defiled me with dust, and this is the one thousand monks like Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，緣彼忍辱誓當先度，是故道成，此等之眾先得度苦。」
translation: At that point, I'll first save them because of their forbearance and vow; therefore, the path is accomplished, and these people will first be liberated from suffering.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，聞佛所說，歎未曾有，歡喜奉行。
translation: When the monks heard what the Buddha taught, they marveled at this unprecedented experience and rejoiced to receive it and carried it out.

source_sentence: （一三）慈力王血施品第十三
translation: (13) Chapter 13: The blood donation of the King of Compassionate Kings

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇洹中止。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Jeta’s Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時尊者阿難，於中食後，林間坐禪，而自思惟：「如來興世，甚為奇特，
translation: At that time, after the midday meal, Venerable Ānanda was seated in meditation in the forest. He thought to himself: It is most wonderful that the Tathāgata should appear in this world.

source_sentence: 眾生之類，皆蒙安樂。」
translation: All kinds of sentient beings will be made comfortable.

source_sentence: 又思惟：「憍陳如等五尊比丘，種何善本，依何因緣，法門初開，而先得入，
translation: Again, he thought: O Kauṇḍinya and the five other venerable bhikṣus, what kind of roots of goodness did you sow and on what basis and for what reasons did you first open the door of the Dharma? Did you enter it before?

source_sentence: 法鼓始振，獨先得聞，甘露法降，特先蒙潤？」
translation: When the Dharma drum begins to shake, they're the first to hear it; when the Dharma of immortality descends, they're the first to be nourished?

source_sentence: 念是事已，從坐處起，往至佛所，具以所念，而用白佛。
translation: Having thought of these things, he rose from his seat and went to the Buddha’s place. Upon hearing this thought, he reported it to him.

source_sentence: 佛告之曰：「憍陳如等，先世於我，實有因緣。
translation: The Buddha told them, Kauṇḍinya and so forth, there really were causes and conditions in the past lives of me.

source_sentence: 過去世時，我以身血，充其飢渴，令得安隱；
translation: In a past life I filled their hunger and thirst with my own blood, enabling them to be at ease.

source_sentence: 是故今身，先得我法，用致解脫。」
translation: Therefore, in my present body, I've previously attained my teaching and used it to attain liberation.

source_sentence: 賢者阿難，重白佛言：「過去以血濟其飢乏，其事云何？
translation: Good man Ānanda repeatedly said to the Buddha: In the past I relieved him of his hunger and thirst with my blood. What happened?

source_sentence: 願具開示，并令眾會咸得解了。」
translation: May it be fully revealed, and may the assembly all attain understanding.

source_sentence: 佛告之曰：「過去久遠阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有大國王，名彌佉羅拔羅，
translation: The Buddha said to them: Long ago, long before an incalculable number of kalpas ago, there was a great king named Miliṇḍapālī in this Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 晉言慈力，領閻浮提八萬四千小國王，有二萬夫人、一萬大臣。
translation: He ruled over eighty-four thousand small kingdoms in Jambudvīpa, with twenty-thousand wives and ten thousand ministers.

source_sentence: 王有慈悲，具四等心，恒愍一切，未曾懈厭，常以十善，教誨民庶，四方欽慕。
translation: The king was compassionate and sympathetic, imbued with the four kinds of equal mind. He always pityed all living beings without laziness; he always taught the people by means of the ten good deeds so that they would admire him in all quarters.

source_sentence: 王所化治，國土安樂，莫不慶賴。
translation: The king ruled the empire, and all the people lived in peace and happiness in his land.

source_sentence: 諸疫鬼輩，恒噉人血氣，用自濟活。
translation: The epidemics and ghosts constantly poisoned the blood and vitality of human beings, using it to rescue themselves.

source_sentence: 爾時人民，攝身口意，敦從十善；
translation: At that time the people gathered together their bodies, speech, and minds to follow the ten norms of good conduct.

source_sentence: 眾邪惡疫，不敢侵近，飢羸困乏，瘦悴無力。
translation: They are afflicted by various evil epidemics and do not dare to attack or approach them. Being hungry, weak, exhausted, emaciated, and helpless, they cannot get close to the enemy.

source_sentence: 時五夜叉，來至王所，『我等徒類，仰人血氣，得全身命。
translation: The five yakṣas then came to the king's presence, saying, 'We are all of our own kind, and we look up to the blood and energy of humans to attain their whole life.

source_sentence: 由王教導，咸持十善，我等自是無復飲食，飢渴頓乏，求活無路。
translation: As a result of the king’s instruction, we all maintained the ten wholesome practices. Since then we have no food or drink and are hungry, thirsty, and in distress, and there is no way to live.

source_sentence: 大王慈悲！
translation: Great king, compassionate!

source_sentence: 豈不矜愍？』
translation: Isn't it because they're conceited?'

source_sentence: 王聞是語，甚懷哀傷，即自放脈，刺身五處。
translation: Having heard these words, the king was greatly grieved and immediately released his own veins and stabbed five parts of his body.

source_sentence: 時五夜叉，各自持器，來承血飲，飲血飽滿，咸賴王恩，欣喜無量。
translation: Each of the five yakṣas then brought a container to receive their blood and drank it, filling it with drinking blood. All relied on the king’s kindness and delighted immeasurably.

source_sentence: 王復告曰：『汝若充足，念修十善，我今以身血，濟汝飢渴，令得安隱；
translation: The king said to them, “If you are well provided for your food and keep the ten kinds of good deeds in mind, I will rescue you from hunger and thirst with my own blood so that you may find peace and ease.

source_sentence: 後成佛時，當以法身戒定慧血，除汝三毒諸欲飢渴，安置涅槃安隱之處。』
translation: When you later become a buddha, you will use the Dharma body, morality, concentration, wisdom, and blood to remove your three poisons of hunger and thirst and place yourself in nirvāṇa in a peaceful place.'

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 欲知爾時慈力王者，今我身是。
translation: I want to know that the king of the power of compassion at that time is now me.

source_sentence: 五夜叉者，今憍陳如等五比丘是。
translation: The five yakṣas are the five monks of Kauṇḍinya and so forth.

source_sentence: 我世世誓願，許當先度，是故我初說法，聞便解脫。」
translation: I've vowed from generation to generation that I'll be liberated first, so when I first teach the Dharma and hear it, I'll be liberated.

source_sentence: 時尊者阿難，及諸眾會，聞佛所說，咸增敬仰，歡喜奉行。
translation: When Venerable Ānanda and the other members of the assembly heard the Buddha’s exhortation, they all increased in reverence and veneration. They were delighted and remembered it well.

source_sentence: （一四）降六師品第十四
translation: (24) Chapter 14 of the Tenth Chapter of the Subjugation of the Six Teachers

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在王舍城竹園之中，與千二百五十比丘俱。
translation: Thus I have heard. One time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha, in the bamboo grove of the city of Vaiśālī, accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 時洴沙王已得初果，信敬之心倍復隆厚，常設上妙四事所須，供養於佛及比丘僧，
translation: The king of Kauśinagara had already attained the first realization, and his faith and reverence increased even more. He always prepared the most wonderful offerings for the four requisites needed to support the Buddha and the assembly of monks.

source_sentence: 樂人同善，志兼勸導。
translation: They delight in people who are all the same as good and share the same aspiration to encourage and guide them.

source_sentence: 國有六師，富蘭那等，先素出世，邪見倒說，誑惑民庶；
translation: In the country there were six teachers, such as Fulan and others, who had previously renounced the world. They held wrong views and taught false doctrines to deceive the common people.

source_sentence: 迷冥之徒，信服邪教，眾類廣布，惡黨遍滿。
translation: Those who are deluded believe in heretical doctrines, spreading widely among various sects and full of evil bands.

source_sentence: 時王有弟，敬奉六師，信惑邪倒，謂其有道，竭家之貨，供給與之。
translation: The king had a younger brother who respected the six teachers and believed in error, saying that he had the Way. He gave him all the goods of his house as an offering.

source_sentence: 佛日初出，慧流肇潤，無心拔擢，沒在重網，兄王洴沙，甚愛重之，慇懃方便，
translation: When the Buddha’s sun began to rise on the first day of the month, the stream of his wisdom flourished and moistened him. He had no intention of uprooting it but simply disappeared into a heavy net. His elder brother was fond of sand; he cherished it very much and took pity on the worldly means of salvation.

source_sentence: 曉令奉佛，弟執邪理，不從王教，數數勅令請佛供養。
translation: Knowing that he had been instructed to serve the Buddha, his younger brother held a wrong doctrine and did not follow the king’s instruction. He repeatedly instructed him to invite the Buddha to make offerings to him.

source_sentence: 弟白兄王：「我自有師，不能復往奉事瞿曇。
translation: The younger brother said to his elder brother, “I have a teacher. I cannot go and serve Gautama any more.

source_sentence: 然王有教理無有違，當設大會不限來眾，若其自至，我當與食。」
translation: However, if the king has teachings and principles that are not contradictory, he'll set up a large assembly with no limit to the number of people who come, and if they come on their own, I will give them food.

source_sentence: 許王之後辦設供具，饒敷床座，事訖設會，遣人往喚，六師之徒，尋皆來集，
translation: After the king had arranged the necessary provisions, he spread out his bed and seat. When the work was done, the assembly was called by an envoy to summon the Master. The six teachers were assembled together as soon as possible.

source_sentence: 坐於上位，怪佛及僧不自來至，即往白王：「王前數數勅請瞿曇，今為設會，
translation: Surprised that the Buddha and the members of the sangha had not come, they went to the king’s presence and said: Your majesty, I have already invited Gautama several times before.

source_sentence: 日時欲至，如何不來？」
translation: When the sun is about to come, why won't it come?

source_sentence: 王告弟言：「汝雖不能躬自往請，可遣一人白於時到。」
translation: The king told his disciple, Even though you can't go in person to ask for it, you can send a man to tell him when he arrives.

source_sentence: 王弟受教遣人白時，佛與大眾來至會所，見諸六師先坐上座，佛與眾僧次第而坐。
translation: When the king's younger brother was instructed to send someone to tell him, the Buddha and the assembled people came to the assembly and saw the six masters first sit on the superior seat, and the Buddha and the saṃgha were seated in order.

source_sentence: 佛以神足，令此六師合其徒類，忽在下行，六師情恥，各起移坐，坐定自見，
translation: The Buddha, using his supernatural power of travel, caused the six śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas to assemble with their retinues. Suddenly they came down from their seats in the assembly hall. With shame, each of the six śramaṇas stood up and departed to see for himself while sitting in meditation.

source_sentence: 還在其下。
translation: It's still below them.

source_sentence: 如是再三，移坐就上，猶自見身，乃在下末，更無力能，俛仰而坐。
translation: In the same way, three times and three times he moved his seat upward. As soon as he saw his own body, he sat cross-legged in the lower part of the mountain but did not have the strength to do so. He looked upward and sat down.

source_sentence: 檀越行水，至上座前，佛語施主：「先與汝師。」
translation: When the donor walks water and arrives in front of the superior seat, the Buddha says to the donor, First give it to your teacher.

source_sentence: 持水往師前，即舉甖，甖口自閉，其水不下；
translation: Going before the teacher with water, he raised his bowl and closed his mouth. The water didn’t go down.

source_sentence: 還往佛前，從佛作次，爾乃水出，咸得洗手。
translation: They went back to the place before the Buddha and followed him one after another. Then water came out and they were all allowed to wash their hands.

source_sentence: 洗手既竟，次當呪願，檀越捉食，在上座前，佛語檀越：「本不為我，
translation: After washing his hands, he should next make a magical vow. The donor takes food and is seated in front of the superior monk.

source_sentence: 往汝師前，自令呪願。」
translation: I'll go before your teacher and make my own dhāraṇī vow.

source_sentence: 受教尋往，至六師所，六師口噤，不得出言，但各舉手，遙指於佛，佛便呪願，
translation: Having been instructed, they went to the place where the six masters were staying. The six masters remained silent and could not utter a word. Each simply raised his hand and pointed at the Buddha from a distance.

source_sentence: 梵音聲暢。
translation: The Sanskrit sound is fluent.

source_sentence: 呪願既竟，次當行食，欲隨上座，作次付之。
translation: After finishing the dhāraṇī and vows, he'll then go on to eat, want to follow the superior seat, and give it to him in order.

source_sentence: 佛又告言：「先與汝師。」
translation: The Buddha again told him, First, give it to your teacher.

source_sentence: 即便持食，從六師付，食皆忽上，住虛空中，各當其上，取不可得；
translation: He then took the food and handed it to the six teachers. The food suddenly rose up into the air, but each of them climbed on top of the other; they were unable to get it.

source_sentence: 行食與佛并僧遍訖，食乃還下，各在其前。
translation: When the food had been given to the Buddha and the members of the sangha, they all ate it. After having finished eating, they returned downstairs and were each in front of him.

source_sentence: 佛與眾僧，一切食訖，澡漱還坐，次當說法，佛語檀越：「令汝師說。」
translation: When the Buddha and the saṃgha had finished all their food, he washed and returned to his seat. Next, he taught the Dharma, and the Buddha said to the donor, Have your teacher teach it.

source_sentence: 尋請六師，六師復噤，但各同時，舉手指佛。
translation: He invited the six masters, but each of them simultaneously raised their fingers to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 於是如來，廣為眾會，出柔軟音，暢演法性，分別義理，應適眾情。
translation: The Tathāgata then spoke to the assembly in an extensive way, producing a gentle voice that explained the essence of the Dharma fluently. He discerned meanings and principles so as to adapt to people’s emotions.

source_sentence: 聞佛說法，咸得開解，洴沙王弟，得法眼淨，其餘眾人，或得初果，至第三果，
translation: When they hear the Buddha preaching the Dharma they will all attain enlightenment. The duly anointed khaṭṭṭika king’s disciples will attain purification of the dharma eye, while others may attain the first realization or even the third realization.

source_sentence: 出家盡漏，發無上心，住不退地，隨心所慕，悉得其願，各乃識真，信敬三寶，
translation: They renounced the householder’s life, exhausted their contaminants, aroused the highest aspiration, and remained in the stage of nonbacksliding. Whatever they desired, they all attained what they wished. Each knew the truth and believed in and respected the Triple Gem.

source_sentence: 薄賤六師，捨不承供。
translation: The six teachers who were weak and inferior abandoned them and did not accept the offerings.

source_sentence: 於是六師，甚懷惱恚，各至閑靜，求學奇術，天魔波旬，懼其情怯，不能宣布惡邪之毒，
translation: The six teachers were greatly disturbed and angry, and each went to a quiet place to study the wonderful arts. Deva Māra Pāpīyān feared that they would not be able to announce the poison of evil.

source_sentence: 即下化作六師之形，於一人前，現五人術，飛行空中，身出水火，分身散體，
translation: He then descended and magically created the form of the six masters. In front of one person, he manifested the five kinds of skillful means for flying in midair. Water and fire came out of his body and dispersed his body.

source_sentence: 百種現變。
translation: There are a hundred kinds of manifestations.

source_sentence: 愚癡之徒，更相恃賴，忿前見辱亡失供養，六師悉集，各共議言：「我曹技能，
translation: The ignorant and deluded monks relied on each other to make offerings in anger at the sight of their disgrace. Six masters assembled, discussing among themselves:

source_sentence: 不減瞿曇，緣前一辱，眾心離散。
translation: Because of the previous insult, the minds of the people were distracted and scattered.

source_sentence: 比來眾師，神術顯變，今察奇妙，足任伏彼，當詣國王求決勝負。」
translation: The teachers of the Buddha have shown their miraculous abilities, and now they're investigating marvelous things that are sufficient to subdue them, so they'll go to the king to seek a victory or defeat.

source_sentence: 作議已定，即詣王所，自說智能神化靈術，貪共沙門，講挌奇變，對試之後，
translation: Having settled the matter, he approached the king and explained to him his knowledge of magical creations and supernatural powers. Desiring to associate with the śramaṇas, he talked about marvelous transformations. After examining them, he said:

source_sentence: 可否自現。
translation: Can you show it yourself?

source_sentence: 王笑之曰：「汝等何癡？
translation: The king laughed at him and said, “Why are you so ignorant?

source_sentence: 佛德弘大，神足無礙，欲以螢大與日諍光，牛跡之水與巨海比大，野干之微與師子捔猛，
translation: The Buddha’s virtue was so great that his supernormal powers were unobstructed. He wanted to match the light of the firefly with the brightness of the sun and wished to make the water at the site of the ox’s rebirth as big as a great ocean, while the tiny size of the wild elephant in the forest became as large as a lion’

source_sentence: 蟻蛭之堆與須彌等高；
translation: The tomb of the ants and leech is as high as Mount Sumeru.

source_sentence: 大小之形，昭然有別，迷惑高企，何愚之劇？」
translation: The forms of large and small are clearly distinct, and what's the folly of being confused and lofty?

source_sentence: 六師復言：「驗事在後，大王未見我等殊變，是使偏心謂望彼大，決試之後，
translation: The six teachers again said, “Dear king, we have not yet seen such a miracle. This is due to the fact that our minds are biased in thinking that they will see the greatness of your majesty.

source_sentence: 巨細自定。」
translation: It's a great and subtle self-determination.

source_sentence: 王又告曰：「欲試可試，但恐汝等自招毀辱，正使與佛捔神足者，當使我曹具覩異變。」
translation: The king also told them, I want to test it, but I'm afraid you'll humiliate yourself.

source_sentence: 六師言曰：「期後七日，願王平治講試之場。」
translation: The six masters said, Seven days from now, may the king calmly govern the lecture and test site.

source_sentence: 六師去後，王即嚴駕，往至佛所，以事白佛：「六師紛紜，欲得講術，
translation: After the departure of the six teachers, the king prepared his carriage and went to the place where the Buddha was staying. He reported these matters to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 以理呵語，其意不息。
translation: He ridiculed them in principle, but his thoughts didn't stop.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊！
translation: Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 奮其神力，化伏邪惡，爾乃從善，因使我曹得覩其變。」
translation: He arouses his supernormal powers to subdue evil and then follows the good, so that we can see its transformation.

source_sentence: 佛告洴沙：「我自知時。」
translation: The Buddha told Kauṣṭhila, I know the time for myself.

source_sentence: 洴沙謂佛可共捔神，即勅臣吏，平治博處，安施床座，竪諸幢幡，莊嚴挍珞，
translation: The Buddha said, “The sands of the Ganges River is a place where you can live together with me.” So he ordered his ministers and officials to level the vast expanse of land so that it could be used for offering seats, banners, pennants, and ornamented with jewelry.

source_sentence: 極令麗妙。
translation: It's extremely beautiful and marvelous.

source_sentence: 其當會日，一切企望。
translation: On the day of the assembly, they all wished for it.

source_sentence: 於時如來及與眾僧，從王舍城，往毘舍離。
translation: The Tathāgata and the saṃgha then left Rājagṛha and went to Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 毘舍離中，諸律昌輩，與諸人民，皆來奉迎。
translation: In Vaiśālī, the Licchavi clanspeople and the people came to greet him.

source_sentence: 諸人後日，求佛不在，問實乃知，至毘舍離。
translation: On a later day, the people asked if the Buddha wasn't here, and after questioning him for his truth, they went to Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 六師之徒，興張唱言：「久知瞿曇智術單淺，諸人猶豫，不信我言，尅期捔術，
translation: The six teachers of the assembly raised their voices and said, “We have known for a long time that Gautama’s wisdom is superficial. People are hesitant and do not believe what I say.

source_sentence: 自省不如靡然逃去，至毘舍離。」
translation: Self-observation isn't like fleeing from Vaiśālī and arriving at Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 諸六師輩，貢高轉盛，各共相率，當必追窮。
translation: Each of the six groups of śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas became so arrogant and arrogant that they would surely be driven away.

source_sentence: 時洴沙王，辦設供具，滿五百乘車，王與群臣十四億眾，各辦糧食，悉隨佛往，
translation: At that time the king of Kauśinagara prepared provisions and five hundred carriages filled with offerings. The king and his ministers, together with fourteen billion members of the assembly, each provided provisions and food for the Buddha’s arrival.

source_sentence: 前後絡繹，集毘舍離，六師復往白諸律昌：「聽我曹等，與此瞿曇，捔試神力，
translation: The first and second divisions of the army assembled at Vaiśālī. The six generals went again to report to the Licchavi ministers, “Please allow us, sirs, to give this Gautama some time to test his supernatural powers.

source_sentence: 談講實性，若見聽者，期來七日。」
translation: If you see someone who's listening to the true nature of the lecture, they'll come seven days from now.

source_sentence: 時諸律昌，復往白佛：「六師群迷，自謂有道，求與如來共捔神力，唯願世尊！
translation: The Licchavi ministers then went back to the Buddha and said, The six masters are deluded, claiming to have the Way, and they're seeking to share the Tathāgata's supernormal powers with them, so please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 垂神降伏。」
translation: I'll be subjugated by the gods.

source_sentence: 佛又告曰：「佛自知時。」
translation: The Buddha again told him, When the Buddha knows for himself.

source_sentence: 諸律昌輩，合率臣民，嚴治設辦，如洴沙王比，悉皆企慕，望在明日。
translation: All the Licchavi clanspeople, together with their ministers and subjects, governed themselves in such a strict manner that they were comparable to those of King Upariṭṭṭha. They all cherished this idea and wished to see him on the morrow.

source_sentence: 佛與眾僧，至拘睒彌。
translation: The Buddha and the monks arrived at Kauśāmbī.

source_sentence: 拘睒彌王，名曰優填，將諸群臣，亦來奉迎。
translation: The king of Kauśāmbī, named Udayana, and his ministers also came to greet him.

source_sentence: 毘舍離人，明晨問佛，云佛已往拘睒彌國。
translation: The Vaiśālī people asked the Buddha questions in the morning, saying that he had already gone to Kauśāmbī.

source_sentence: 六師聞是高心遂盛，合徒聚眾，規必窮逼。
translation: When the six masters heard this, their high resolve prevailed and they gathered a large group of disciples. The rules were bound to oppress them all.

source_sentence: 諸律昌輩，辦致供具，五百車載，用俟供養，將領國人七億之眾，并洴沙王，
translation: The Licchavi clanspeople prepared an offering of five hundred chariots and carried the relics in their carts for worship. They led seven hundred million people, including the king of Kauśinagara, as well as all the other members of the sangha.

source_sentence: 集拘睒彌，觀佛六師共捔神力，前後滿道，絡繹而至。
translation: He assembled in Kauśāmbī and observed the Buddha’s miraculous powers with the help of his supernatural powers. Before and after, he fulfilled all the paths leading up to enlightenment and arrived at Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 六師既到，見優填王騰說事情如上之辭，沙門自省：「內無顧恃，空空逃避，
translation: When the six teachers had arrived, he saw King Udayana speak these words as above. The śramaṇa thought to himself, “I have no internal self-reliance and flee through emptiness and voidness.

source_sentence: 不可要勒，須王尅定令與我試。」
translation: You can't give it to me, but I need the king to make sure and order me to test it.

source_sentence: 優填白佛，說六師辭：「世尊！
translation: Udayana addressed the Buddha and said to the six masters, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 寧可與捔之不？」
translation: Would you like to give it to him?

source_sentence: 佛復告言：「我自知時。」
translation: The Buddha again told them, I know the time for myself.

source_sentence: 優填望佛在其國試，嚴治設辦，如洴沙王比，皆到當會。
translation: Udayana hoped that the Buddha would be present in his country to test him, and he ruled it as if he were a king of sands; they all came to the assembly.

source_sentence: 佛復捨去，與比丘僧，至越祇國。
translation: The Buddha again departed and, accompanied by the bhikṣus and monks, arrived in the country of Vṛji.

source_sentence: 越祇國王屯真陀羅，將諸人民，來迎世尊。
translation: The king of Vṛji came to meet the World-honored One, surrounded by the people of Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 拘睒彌人明日乃問，云佛已去向於越祇。
translation: The Kauśāmbī people asked him tomorrow, saying that the Buddha had departed and was headed for Vṛji.

source_sentence: 六師徒眾，尋逐其後。
translation: The six teachers and their disciples followed him.

source_sentence: 時優填王與八億眾，并洴沙等諸國人民，悉共往詣，集越祇國。
translation: King Udayana, accompanied by eight hundred million kings and the people of Jambudvīpa and so forth, came together to assemble in the country of Vṛji.

source_sentence: 六師見王，廣自陳說：「當令瞿曇與我共試。」
translation: Seeing the king, the six masters told him in detail, You will cause Gautama to test it with me.

source_sentence: 屯真陀羅復往白佛，佛猶答言：「佛自知時。」
translation: Tuṣita then went back to the Buddha and said, The Buddha still answered, When the Buddha knows for himself.

source_sentence: 王亦嚴辦。
translation: The king also arranged it in a proper way.

source_sentence: 會日垂至，佛與眾僧，即向特叉尸利。
translation: When the day of the assembly arrived, the Buddha and the saṃgha went to Taksaśilī.

source_sentence: 此國中王名因陀婆彌，與諸臣民，亦來奉迎。
translation: The king of this country, named Indrabhami, and his ministers also came to greet him.

source_sentence: 屯真陀羅與五億人，洴沙王等諸王臣民，亦皆逐佛，向特叉尸利。
translation: Tuṣita and his five hundred million people, the king of Kauśinagara and other royal ministers all chased the Buddha and headed for Taksaśilī.

source_sentence: 六師已到，白因陀婆彌，極自譸張，高談大語：「聽與瞿曇捔試神力。」
translation: When the six masters arrived, they said to Indrabhami, who became very angry and talked loudly, Hear me test my supernormal powers with Gautama.

source_sentence: 因陀婆彌復往白佛，佛故答言：「我自知時。」
translation: Again, Indra Bodhi went to the Buddha and said, When I know it for myself.

source_sentence: 嚴辦日到，佛復捨去，并與諸眾僧，至波羅[木*奈]。
translation: On the day of his arrival, the Buddha again departed. Accompanied by the other monks, he arrived at Benares.

source_sentence: 波羅[木*奈]王名梵摩達，亦與人眾，躬來迎佛。
translation: The king of Vārāṇasī, named Brahmadatta, came in person to greet the Buddha together with his retinue.

source_sentence: 特叉尸利人民，明日乃知佛去。
translation: The Takṣaśi people knew the Buddha’s departure tomorrow.

source_sentence: 六師追逐，尋跡馳往。
translation: The six teachers chased the Master, chasing him in search of his whereabouts.

source_sentence: 因陀婆彌與六億眾、洴沙王等，一切隨逐。
translation: Indrabhami and the six hundred million people, as well as the king of sands and so forth, all followed him.

source_sentence: 六師既到，如前白王。
translation: When the six masters arrived, they reported to the king as before.

source_sentence: 王如前辭，往白於佛，佛亦答言：「我自知時。」
translation: The king, as before, went to the Buddha and told him, and he answered, I know it for myself.

source_sentence: 嚴辦日到，佛復捨去，與比丘僧，往迦毘羅衛國。
translation: On the day of his arrival at Sāvatthī, the Buddha again departed. He accompanied the monks and nuns on their way to Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 迦毘羅衛諸釋種輩，率諸大眾，皆來迎佛。
translation: Kapilavastu and the other members of the Śākya clan, leading the great assembly, came to greet the Buddha.

source_sentence: 波羅[木*奈]人，明日乃知。
translation: The people of Vārāṇasī will know it tomorrow.

source_sentence: 六師徒眾，續復馳逐。
translation: The six teachers and their disciples continued to chase after him.

source_sentence: 梵摩達王與八億人，洴沙諸王六國人民，皆悉前後，隨逐佛往。
translation: King Brahmadatta and his eight hundred million people, as well as the duly anointed khattiya kings and the people of the six countries, all came before and followed the Buddha’s departure.

source_sentence: 六師既到，向諸釋種，紛紜自說：「廣引術能，聽與瞿曇，共決神力。」
translation: When the six masters arrived, they faced the Śākyas and argued among themselves, saying, quote their skillfulness extensively, listening to Gautama and determine his supernormal powers together.

source_sentence: 釋種復往白佛，具宣其事，佛又告言：「我自知時。」
translation: Again, the Śākyamuni went to the Buddha and told him all about it, and he again told him, When I know for myself.

source_sentence: 嚴治設辦，剋日垂至，佛與眾僧，往舍衛國。
translation: The Buddha and the monks went to Sāvatthī.

source_sentence: 舍衛國王名波斯匿，與諸臣民，皆來迎佛。
translation: The king of Śrāvastī named Prasenajit and his ministers all came to greet the Buddha.

source_sentence: 釋種明日乃知佛去。
translation: The Śākyamuni then knew the Buddha's departure tomorrow.

source_sentence: 六師率徒，從後追之。
translation: The six teachers led their disciples to chase after him from behind.

source_sentence: 釋種將領九億人眾，洴沙王等諸國人民，亘川滿野，逐趣舍衛。
translation: The Śākya clan led a multitude of nine hundred million people, and the kings of Kauśinagara and other nations crossed rivers and filled the wilderness to go to Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 六師等到，見波斯匿，具自陳說本末情事：「欲與瞿曇決捔神力，臨期逃避，
translation: When the six teachers waited, they saw Prasenajit and told him all about their past affairs. They wanted to give Gautama’s supernatural powers so that he could flee at the right time.

source_sentence: 不可要勒。
translation: You can't ask for it.

source_sentence: 今與大眾，逐至王國。
translation: Now, I'll go with the crowd to the kingdom.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 當使與我等決。」
translation: You must make a decision with us.

source_sentence: 波斯匿王，亦用為笑，說佛殊變難可思議，云何以汝卑陋凡細，與大法王捔試力能？
translation: King Prasenajit also used it as a laughter to explain that the Buddha's extraordinary transformations are difficult and inconceivable, so why would you be able to compare your humble and ordinary subtlety with the great king of the Dharma?

source_sentence: 六師凶凶，言氣遂高。
translation: The six teachers were fierce and evil, and their words became lofty.

source_sentence: 波斯匿王，既往見佛白言：「六師慇懃乃爾，唯願世尊！
translation: When King Prasenajit went there, he saw the Buddha and said, So it is with the six masters, please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 垂神化伏，普使一切別偽識真。」
translation: I'll be subdued by mystical transformation, causing all the distinctive and false consciousnesses to be true.

source_sentence: 佛告王言：「我自知時。」
translation: The Buddha told the king, I know it for myself.

source_sentence: 波斯匿王，尋勅臣吏，平治場地，多積香花，敷設床座，竪諸幢幡，嚴辦已訖，
translation: King Prasenajit ordered his officials to level the terraces and built many fragrant flower beds and seats, as well as various banners and pennants.

source_sentence: 大眾都集。
translation: The masses all gathered together.

source_sentence: 臘月一日，佛至試場，波斯匿王，是日設食，清晨躬手授佛楊枝，佛受嚼竟，
translation: On the first day in the first month of the new year, when the Buddha had arrived at the terrace for his testimony, King Prasenajit prepared a meal on that day. Early in the morning he gave the Buddha a tooth relic with his own hand; and having eaten it, the Buddha chewed it until it was done.

source_sentence: 擲殘著地墮地便生，蓊欝而起，根莖踊出，高五百由旬，枝葉雲布，周匝亦爾。
translation: The roots and stems sprouted, rising high up to a height of five hundred yojanas. Branches and leaves spread like clouds all around the tree.

source_sentence: 漸復生華，大如車輪，遂復有菓，大五斗瓶，根莖枝葉，純是七寶若干種色，
translation: There gradually grows another flower the size of a carriage wheel. Then there is another fruit as big as a five-pound jar, with roots, stems, branches, leaves, and flowers that are all made of the seven kinds of precious substances.

source_sentence: 映燦麗妙，隨色發光，掩蔽日月。
translation: It shines brilliantly and beautifully, emitting light that obscures the sun and moon according to their colors.

source_sentence: 食其菓者，美踰甘露，香氣四塞，聞者情悅；
translation: Those who ate the fruit were delicious and surpassed the sweetness of immortality. Their fragrance was so strong that those who heard it rejoiced.

source_sentence: 香風來吹，更相摚觸，枝葉皆出和雅之音，暢演法要，聞者無厭。
translation: The fragrant wind blows and they touch each other. All the branches and leaves produce harmonious sounds that explain the essentials of the Dharma in an unhurried way, without tire for those who hear them.

source_sentence: 一切人民，覩茲樹變，敬信之心，倍益純厚。
translation: All the people saw the miraculous transformation of this tree, and their faith in it became even more pure and strong.

source_sentence: 佛乃說法，應適其意，心皆開解，志求佛者、得果生天，數甚眾多。
translation: The Buddha then taught the Dharma, adapting it according to their wishes, and they all became enlightened in mind. Quite a large number of those who set out for buddhahood and attained fruition were born in heaven.

source_sentence: 次第二日，優填王請佛。
translation: On the second day after that, King Udayana invited the Buddha.

source_sentence: 於時如來，化其兩邊，成兩寶山，嚴顯可觀，眾寶雜合，五色暉耀，光焰暐曄，
translation: The Tathāgata then magnified the two sides of the mountain and formed a mountain of duality of jewels, which was beautifully arrayed and could be seen. All the jewels combined together to form a multicolored shining five-colored phenomenon that shone brilliantly with blazing flames and music.

source_sentence: 若干種樹，行列山上，華果茂盛，出微妙香。
translation: Various kinds of trees stood in rows on the mountain. Flowers and fruit were abundant and produced a delicate fragrance.

source_sentence: 其一山頂，有成熟粳米，滑美百味，甘之附口，人民之類，自恣而食。
translation: At the top of one mountain there is ripened millet, which has a hundred sweet and delicate flavors. All the people eat it as freely as they wish.

source_sentence: 其一山上，有柔軟之草，肥[月*巽]甘美，以俟畜生，須者往噉，飽已情歡。
translation: On the top of one mountain there was a soft blade of grass, rich and sweet like moonlight. Those who wished to eat it would wait until the animals were fed before they could do so. Having devoured them, they rejoiced in joy.

source_sentence: 一切眾會，覩山顯異，食已懷悅，仰慕遂深。
translation: All the assembled monks were delighted at the sight of the mountain and deeply admired it after they had eaten.

source_sentence: 佛更稱適，為說妙法，各得開解，發無上心，得果生天，其數亦眾。
translation: The Buddha then called them suitable and preached the wonderful Dharma for them, each gaining an enlightenment, aroused the unsurpassed mind, and attained fruitful birth in heaven, which was also numerous.

source_sentence: 到第三日，屯真陀羅，請佛供養，奉佛淨水，俟以澡漱。
translation: On the third day he stayed in Tuṣita Monastery to invite the Buddha to make offerings to him and offered him clean water, waiting for him to wash his hands.

source_sentence: 佛吐水棄，化成寶池，周匝四邊，各二百里，純以七寶共相間雜，眾色相照，
translation: The Buddha expelled water and discarded it, transforming it into a jeweled pond, two hundred li on each of the four sides in circumference, purely mixed with the seven kinds of treasure. All its colors shone upon each other.

source_sentence: 光明焰奕。
translation: The blazing flame of light shines brightly.

source_sentence: 其池中水，八德具足，水底遍滿七寶之沙，八種蓮花，大如車輪，青黃赤白，
translation: The water in the pond was endowed with the eight kinds of virtue. The bottom of the lake was covered with sand made of the seven kinds of treasure, and there were eight kinds of lotus blossoms as big as a carriage wheel, blue, yellow, red, and white.

source_sentence: 紅綠紫雜，香氣芬馥，馨徹四遠。
translation: The colors of red, green, and purple are mixed together with a fragrant odor that penetrates the four directions.

source_sentence: 隨蓮花色，各發光明，光明顯照，暉曜天地。
translation: Each of the colors of the lotus blossoms emitted a ray of light that shone brightly, illuminating heaven and earth.

source_sentence: 大會覩此寶池奇妙，歡喜稱歎佛無量德。
translation: The great assembly saw that this jeweled pond was marvelous and rejoiced in praising the Buddha’s immeasurable virtue.

source_sentence: 佛因觀察，隨眾人心，方便說法，各令開解發無上心，得果生天，盡增福業，
translation: The Buddha then observed and taught the Dharma according to the minds of those beings, enabling them to resolve their doubts and give rise to unexcelled aspirations. They attained rebirth in heaven as a fruit and exhausted all meritorious deeds.

source_sentence: 數多難計。
translation: The number is numerous and difficult to calculate.

source_sentence: 到第四日，因陀婆彌王請佛。
translation: On the fourth day, King Indra Bodhisattva invited the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛於是日，令其寶池，四面自然，有八渠流，還相灌注，自然迴轉。
translation: On that day the Buddha caused the jeweled pond to naturally flow in eight streams on all four sides, returning back and pouring water over each other as it naturally turns.

source_sentence: 水流有聲，其聲清妙，皆說諸法，五根五力、七覺八道、三明六通、六度四等、大慈大悲，
translation: The water flows with sound, and its sound is pure and subtle. It speaks all the teachings: the five faculties, the five powers, the seven forms of enlightenment, the eightfold path, the three knowledges, the six transcendences, the four equanimities, great compassion and great compassion.

source_sentence: 勸發開導，說種種法，一切聞覩，心皆開解，發心求佛，得果生天，增積福慧，
translation: They are encouraged to give rise to enlightenment, explain various teachings, and all the hearers’ minds are liberated. They set out to seek buddhahood, attain fruitful birth in heaven, and increase in virtue and wisdom.

source_sentence: 數甚眾多。
translation: There are so many of them.

source_sentence: 次第五日，梵摩達王，請佛供養。
translation: On the fifth day, King Brahmadatta invited the Buddha to make an offering.

source_sentence: 佛於是日，口中放光，金色赫奕，遍大千土。
translation: On that day the Buddha emitted a ray of light from his mouth, shining brilliantly golden in color and pervading the great chiliocosm.

source_sentence: 光明所觸，一切眾生，三毒五陰，皆自然息，身心快樂，譬如比丘得第三禪。
translation: All sentient beings touched by that light naturally cease the three poisons and five aggregates, and their bodies and minds are blissful, just as a monk attains the third meditation.

source_sentence: 眾會歎怪，志慕佛德。
translation: The assembled monks marveled at this and yearned for the Buddha’s virtue.

source_sentence: 便為說法，各得開解，發大道心，得果生天，進福修慧，數甚眾多。
translation: They then taught the Dharma for them, each attained enlightenment, aroused the mind of great path, and attain fruition in heaven, cultivating merit and wisdom, which were so numerous.

source_sentence: 第六日中，諸律昌輩，次復請佛。
translation: On the sixth day, the Licchavi clanspeople next invited the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛於是日，普令大會一切眾生，心心相知，各各一人知一切心，所念善惡，
translation: On that day the Buddha caused the great assembly of all sentient beings to know each other’s minds, and each one of them knew all their thoughts, whether they were good or bad.

source_sentence: 志趣業行。
translation: They aspire to karma and practice.

source_sentence: 咸自驚喜，欽美佛德。
translation: They all marveled and admired the Buddha’s virtue.

source_sentence: 佛便為說若干妙法，皆得開解，誓求佛者，得果生天，數甚眾多。
translation: The Buddha then explained various wonderful teachings for them, all of which were enlightened, and those who vowed to seek the Buddha attained fruitful birth in heaven, which was very numerous.

source_sentence: 到第七日，釋種請佛。
translation: On the seventh day, the Śākyamuni invited the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛於是日，化諸會者，悉令自見為轉輪王，七寶千子，諸王臣民，肅恭承已，
translation: On that day the Buddha instructed the assembly members of the assembly so that they would all see themselves as wheel-turning kings with seven treasures and one thousand sons. The royal officials and subjects respectfully received these teachings.

source_sentence: 侍仰無減。
translation: There's no diminution in the number of attendants.

source_sentence: 各自驚怪，喜慶無量。
translation: Each was surprised and overjoyed, with immeasurable joy.

source_sentence: 佛便為說法，投適其意，亦發無上正覺之心，得果生天，甚難計數。
translation: The Buddha then taught the Dharma for them, adapted it to their wishes, and also aroused the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, attaining fruitful birth in heaven, which was very difficult to calculate.

source_sentence: 又第八日受帝釋請，為佛作師子座，如來昇座，帝釋侍左，梵王侍右，
translation: On the eighth day he accepted the invitation of Indra and made a lion seat for the Buddha. The Tathāgata ascended to that seat, Indra stood at his left side and Brahmā sat at his right.

source_sentence: 眾會一切，靜然坐定。
translation: All the members of the assembly sat quietly in meditation.

source_sentence: 佛徐申臂，以手接座，欻有大聲，如象鳴吼，應時即有五大神鬼，摧滅挽拽，
translation: When the Buddha extended his arm slowly and joined his seat with his hand, a loud sound resounded like an elephant’s roar. At that moment five great supernatural spirits appeared to pull the elephants away.

source_sentence: 六師高座，金剛密迹捉金剛杵，杵頭出火，舉擬六師，六師驚怖奔突而走，
translation: On the high seat of the sixth assembly, the Vajrapāṇi Master took the vajra and fire came forth from the top of the vajra. He raised it to summon the six members of the assembly. The six members of the assembly fled in fear.

source_sentence: 慚此重辱，投河而死。
translation: Being ashamed of this humiliation, they rushed into the river and died.

source_sentence: 六師徒類，九億人眾，皆來歸佛，求為弟子。
translation: The six teachers and disciples, who numbered nine hundred million in number, all came to the Buddha and begged to become his disciples.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha said, Well-come monk!

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法衣在身，皆成沙門。
translation: The hair on his beard fell off, and the robes of the Dharma remained on his body. They all became śramaṇas.

source_sentence: 佛為說法，示其法要，漏盡結解，悉得羅漢。
translation: The Buddha preached the Dharma for them, showed them the essentials of the Dharma, ended their contaminants and bonds, and all attained arhatship.

source_sentence: 於是如來，從八萬毛孔，皆放光明，遍滿虛空，一一光頭，有大蓮花，
translation: Then the Buddha emanated rays of light from his eighty-thousand thousand hair pores, filling the sky. At each ray of light there was a great lotus flower that looked like this:

source_sentence: 一一華上，皆有化佛與諸大眾，圍繞說法。
translation: On top of each flower, there's a transformation Buddha and the masses who surround them and teach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 眾會覩茲無上之化，信敬之心，倍益隆盛。
translation: The assembly venerated this peerless teaching, and the mind of faith and reverence increased even more.

source_sentence: 佛即為說，隨其所應，有發大心，得果生天，進福增善，數甚眾多。
translation: The Buddha then explained to them, According to their needs, there are those who arouse great aspirations and attain the fruit of birth in heaven, advance in merit and increase in goodness, which are very numerous.

source_sentence: 到第九日，梵王請佛。
translation: On the ninth day, Brahmā invited the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛自化身高至梵天，威嚴高顯，巍巍難極，放大光明，暉赫天地。
translation: The Buddha himself transformed himself to a great height up to the Brahma heaven, which was so majestic and lofty that it could not be surpassed in its majesty. It emanated great rays of light that shone brilliantly on earth and water.

source_sentence: 一切仰瞻，皆聞其語，佛為種種顯示法要，亦令多眾發心求佛，得果生天，
translation: All those who looked up heard the Buddha’s words. For various purposes he taught them the essentials of the Dharma and also caused many to make resolutions to seek buddhahood, thereby attaining fruitful rebirth in heaven.

source_sentence: 數亦難計。
translation: The number is also difficult to calculate.

source_sentence: 到第十日，四天王請佛。
translation: On the tenth day, the four heavenly kings invited the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊！
translation: At that point, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 普令大眾見佛色身，遍諸天中，從四天王，至色究竟，皆見佛身，放大光明，
translation: All the great assemblies were able to see the buddha’s physical form, pervading all the heavens from the four celestial kings up to Rūpadhātu. They saw the Buddha’s physical form and emanating great light.

source_sentence: 各為大眾，說微妙法。
translation: Each of them explained the subtle Dharma for the masses.

source_sentence: 咸遙仰視，了了見之，一切眾會，甚增敬仰。
translation: They looked up from a distance and saw him clearly. All the monks in the assembly greatly venerated him.

source_sentence: 佛為說法，隨應其意，皆發大心，住不退地，得果生天，不可稱計。
translation: The Buddha taught the Dharma for them, and according to their wishes they all aroused great aspirations, remained in the stage of nonretrogression, and attained fruitful birth in heaven, which can't be measured.

source_sentence: 第十一日，須達請佛。
translation: On the eleventh day, Sudarśana invited the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛於是日，於高座上，自隱其身，寂滅不現，但放光明，出柔軟音，分別演暢諸法之要。
translation: On that day the Buddha remained seated on a raised seat, concealing his body. He was silent and unmanifest but emitted a ray of light that sounded soft and gentle, explaining in detail the essentials of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 在會之人，聞法解悟，有發大心，住不退者，得果生天，亦甚眾多。
translation: Those in the assembly who hear the teaching and understand it, have great aspirations, and abide without retrogression, will attain fruition and be born in heaven, which are also very numerous.

source_sentence: 第十二日，質多居士請佛供養。
translation: On the twelfth day, the householder Qiduo invited the Buddha to make an offering.

source_sentence: 佛於此日，入慈三昧，出金色光，遍照大千。
translation: On that day the Buddha entered the samādhi of compassion and emitted a golden light that shone throughout the great chiliocosm.

source_sentence: 光觸眾生，三毒心息，自然興慈；
translation: When the light touched sentient beings, the three poisons ceased in their minds and spontaneously developed compassion.

source_sentence: 等視眾生，如父如母，如兄如弟，愛潤之心，都無增減。
translation: They look equally at sentient beings as father and mother, brothers and sisters, and nourish their minds with craving without any increase or decrease.

source_sentence: 然後為說若干妙法，亦發大心，住不退地，得果生天，難可稱量。
translation: He then explained some wonderful teachings, also aroused great aspirations, abided in the stage of nonretrogression, and attained fruitful birth in heaven, which was difficult to measure.

source_sentence: 第十三日屯真陀羅王，次復請佛，施設供養。
translation: On the thirteenth day, King Tuṣita again invited the Buddha to make offerings to him.

source_sentence: 佛於是日，身昇高座，放於臍光，分作兩奇，離身七仞，頭各有花，上有化佛，
translation: On that day the Buddha ascended to his high seat and emitted a ray of light from his navel, which was divided into two astounding arrays. Seventy feet seven inches above him, each with its own flower on its head, emanating the magical emanation of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 如佛無異，化佛臍中，復出光明，亦分兩奇離身七仞，頭有蓮花，上有化佛，
translation: In the navel of the apparitional buddha a ray of light also emanated from his body, which was seventy feet in circumference. On its head was a lotus flower, and above it was the apparitional buddha.

source_sentence: 如是轉遍大千國土。
translation: They thus pervade a great chiliocosm.

source_sentence: 一切瞻覩，愕然驚喜。
translation: All the people who saw this marveled in wonder.

source_sentence: 佛為應時，隨意說法，亦發大心，住不退者，得果生天，數甚眾多。
translation: When the Buddha responded, he taught the Dharma as he wished, also arouses great aspirations, and those who abide in nonretrogression attain fruition and are born in the heavens, which are very numerous.

source_sentence: 第十四日，優填王請佛。
translation: On the fourteenth day, King Udayana invited the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時優填王，花散佛上。
translation: At the time, King Udayana scattered flowers on top of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛即應時，變其所散花，作千二百五十七寶高車，高至梵天，晃踰金山，
translation: Then the Buddha, in response, transformed the flowers he scattered into a thousand two hundred and twenty-five-seventh-jeweled high chariot that rose as high as Brahmā Heaven and flew beyond the mountain of gold.

source_sentence: 雜寶眾色，曜麗相照赫然，金光振朗殊妙難量，神珠瓔珞，雜廁其間。
translation: The colors of all the various jewels are brilliant and brilliant, with golden light shining brightly. Extraordinarily sublime and immeasurable is the divine pearl necklace that fills the space between them.

source_sentence: 諸高車中，皆有佛身，放大光明，遍三千土。
translation: In each of the high carts there was a buddha-body, emanating great rays of light that extended throughout the 3,000 lands.

source_sentence: 眾會覩變，喜敬交懷。
translation: All the monks and nuns of the assembly were delighted to see this miraculous phenomenon and revered it.

source_sentence: 佛便說法，應病投藥，皆發大心，或住不退，得道生天，數復甚多。
translation: The Buddha then taught the Dharma, and those who were ill and administered medicine to them all aroused great aspiration. Some of them stayed there without retreating but they attained enlightenment and were reborn in heaven many times.

source_sentence: 第十五日，洴沙王請佛，佛豫勅王：「唯須食具。」
translation: On the fifteenth day, the king of Kauśinagara invited the Buddha, and the Buddha instructed the king, All you need is food preparation.

source_sentence: 王但嚴辦器物，極令饒多。
translation: The king simply arranged all the utensils and goods in an orderly way, causing a great deal of prosperity.

source_sentence: 食時已到，諸器悉滿，甘饍百味，種種異美，普令眾會飽足有餘，食已身心自然安樂。
translation: When the time had come to eat, all the containers were filled with a hundred delicious flavors and various different flavors, causing everyone in the assembly to be satisfied with what remained. After eating, their bodies and minds were naturally at ease.

source_sentence: 於時世尊，以手指地，十八地獄一切都現，無量塵數，諸受罪人，各各自說：「我於本時，
translation: At that time the World-honored One touched the ground with his fingers, and all eighteen hells appeared. All of them were immeasurable in number:

source_sentence: 作如是惡，今受此苦。」
translation: You did such a bad deed, and now you're suffering this pain.

source_sentence: 一切眾會，具悉聞見，甚懷悲愍，衣毛驚悚。
translation: All the members of the assembly heard and saw it all, feeling great grief and sorrow, and their hair stood on end in fear.

source_sentence: 佛便為說法，應適其意，有發大心，住不退者，得果生天，不可稱數。
translation: The Buddha then taught the Dharma for them, adapting it according to their wishes, and those who had aroused great aspiration and stayed there without regressing will attain fruition and be born in heaven, which can't be counted.

source_sentence: 地獄眾生，緣見佛聞法，心生敬仰，皆遙自歸，終皆得生天上人中。
translation: The sentient beings in hell saw the Buddha and heard the Dharma, and their minds became respectful of him. They all returned from a distance to be born among gods and humans.

source_sentence: 時洴沙王，長跪白佛：「世尊奇相，三十有二，身手諸相，猶曾得見，
translation: Ānanda, the king of Kauśinagara knelt down and said to the Buddha: The World-honored One has such a marvelous appearance that he is thirty-two years old. His bodily and verbal marks are as if he had never seen them before.

source_sentence: 未覩如來足下輪相，願見示眾，咸共敬觀。」
translation: I don't see the wheel mark beneath the Tathāgata's feet, so may I show it to the crowd and all of them respectfully observe it together.

source_sentence: 佛即出脚，普示眾會，一切見佛足底輪相，端嚴昞著，文理如畫，分別顯了，
translation: The Buddha then dismounted from his feet and showed them to all the assemblies. All saw the traces on the base of the Buddha’s feet, adorned with embellishments such as those depicted in the scripture; they were clearly distinguished by their distinctive features:

source_sentence: 觀之無厭。
translation: He observes it without tire.

source_sentence: 王益歡喜，重白佛言：「不審世尊！
translation: The king rejoiced and repeatedly said to the Buddha, Not sure, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 本作何德，而乃致此輪相之妙？」
translation: What virtue did you originally create that led to the marvelous appearance of this wheel?

source_sentence: 佛即告王：「由我過去自修十善，復以教人，故得斯相明顯如是。」
translation: The Buddha then told the king, It's because I cultivated these ten good qualities myself in the past and taught them to others that I attained this distinctive appearance like this.

source_sentence: 王又白佛：「不審，世尊！
translation: The king also said to the Buddha, Not sure, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 自修十善，復以教人，其事云何？
translation: What happens when you cultivate the ten good deeds yourself and then teach them to others?

source_sentence: 願見開示。」
translation: May I see it and reveal it to you?

source_sentence: 佛告王曰：「善聽著心。
translation: The Buddha told the king, Listen well and pay attention to your mind.

source_sentence: 乃往無數阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有大國王，名施陀尼彌，領八萬四千國，
translation: In this Jambudvipa there was a great king named Sthavira, who ruled over eighty-four thousand countries for incalculable kalpas.

source_sentence: 八萬億聚落，一萬大臣。
translation: There were eighty myriads of koṭis of villages with 10,000 ministers.

source_sentence: 王有二萬夫人，皆無有子。
translation: The king had twenty thousand wives but none of them had children.

source_sentence: 王甚憂愁，懼絕國嗣，即廣禱祀祈願諸天。
translation: The king was greatly grieved and feared that the throne would be cut off, so he prayed extensively to the gods for their protection.

source_sentence: 王第一夫人，名須梨波羅滿，經數時間，便覺有娠。
translation: The first wife of the king, named Sūryapradīpaṇḍa, became pregnant after several hours.

source_sentence: 自懷妊後，心性聰了，仁慈矜哀，勸人以善，日月滿足，生一男兒，端政超異，
translation: When he was pregnant, his mind and nature were wise and intelligent. He was kind and compassionate; he encouraged people to do good deeds for the sake of their well-being. Every day [the mother] fulfilled her wishes and gave birth to a boy whose appearance was extraordinary in appearance.

source_sentence: 姿相顯美，身諸毛孔，皆有光明。
translation: His appearance was beautiful, and all the pores of his body had light.

source_sentence: 王甚欣慶，覩之無厭。
translation: The king was greatly delighted and never tired of seeing it.

source_sentence: 即召相師，占其吉不？
translation: Will you summon the soothsayer to divine his fortune?

source_sentence: 相師披見，歎言：『奇哉！
translation: When the soothsayer saw this, he praised it, saying, 'How marvelous!'

source_sentence: 是兒之相，挺特殊倫，德綏四域，天下敬戴。』
translation: This is the characteristic of a child who stands out for his special etiquette, whose virtue nourishes the four regions and the world respects and venerates him.'

source_sentence: 王益歡喜，勅為立字。
translation: The king was greatly delighted and ordered him to establish his name.

source_sentence: 相師白王：『有何異瑞？』
translation: The soothsayer said to the king, 'What's the strange sign?'

source_sentence: 王言：『此兒懷妊已來，其母聰慧仁慈勸善，餘瑞雖眾甚怪此異。』
translation: The king said, 'Since this child was pregnant, his mother's intelligence and kindness encouraged him to be good, and the other miraculous signs were so strange that many people wondered about it.'

source_sentence: 相師驚喜，而白王言：『母豫辯慧，自身光明，當為立字名那波羅滿，
translation: Surprised, the soothsayer said to the king, “Your majesty, my dear eloquence and wisdom are so brilliant as to establish a name for me named Upālimaṇḍa.

source_sentence: 晉言惠光。』
translation: It's called Huiguan in the Jin language.'

source_sentence: 太子長大，智慧殊人，父王崩薨，葬送畢訖，諸王臣集勸令嗣位，太子固辭云不能當。
translation: When the prince grew up, he was a man of extraordinary intelligence and wisdom. His father, the king, died and his burial service was over. All the king’s officials gathered to exhort him to succeed to the throne but the prince simply declined by saying that he could not do so.

source_sentence: 諸臣各曰：『大王已崩，唯有太子，更無兄弟。
translation: Each of the ministers said, 'The great king has died, with only the prince and no brothers.

source_sentence: 今言不肯，推讓與誰？』
translation: Now that you say you won't, whom will you give it to?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『世人行惡，必不執順，若加刑罰，罪我不少；
translation: The prince answered, “If the people of this world commit evil deeds they will surely not cling to them. If someone were to impose punishment on me, I would have committed many sins.

source_sentence: 若能率民普行十善，我乃堪任領受國事。』
translation: If I can lead my people to universally practice the ten good qualities, then I'll be able to take charge of national affairs.'

source_sentence: 諸臣言：『善！
translation: The ministers said, 'Good!

source_sentence: 唯願昇殿，十善之道，當勅令行。』
translation: Please ascend to the hall and follow the ten good paths, and I'll order you to do so.'

source_sentence: 太子爾時，尋登王位，告下人民，普行十善，一切敬順，改心易操。
translation: At the time, the prince ascended to the throne and told the people below him to perform the ten good deeds, all with respect and obedience, and change their minds easily.

source_sentence: 魔王妬忌，欲敗王化，密作封書，告下諸國：『前勅行善，既無利驗，
translation: Being jealous, the king of Māra wished to defeat the king and conquer him. He secretly composed a letter of entrustment in which he told his subjects: I have previously instructed you to perform good deeds but there is no reward for them.

source_sentence: 唐自勞苦，修無益事；
translation: The people of the Tang Dynasty suffered self-imposed suffering and cultivated useless deeds.

source_sentence: 自今以往，聽民恣心，作十惡事，勿更憚情。』
translation: From now on, listen to the people's free will and do the ten bad things without further worries.'

source_sentence: 諸王得書，怪此異詔，何緣越理，勸人從惡？
translation: When the kings received the letter, they wondered why this strange decree had transcended reason and encouraged people to abstain from evil.

source_sentence: 各遣親信，重問所由。
translation: Each of them sent their relatives and asked the reason again.

source_sentence: 王聞是語，愕然驚曰：『我無是令，何緣乃爾？』
translation: When the king heard these words, he was startled and frightened, saying, 'I don't have this order, so why is that?'

source_sentence: 即勅嚴駕，躬行諸國，親見臣民，宣改異化。
translation: He ordered the imperial court to prepare a carriage and proceeded in person through various countries. Seeing his ministers and subjects, he preached the theories of heretical teachings.

source_sentence: 魔於道邊，化作一人，身處大火，盛炎熾燃，於中哭叫，聲悲酸切。
translation: At the side of the road, Māra transformed himself into a single person whose body was engulfed in great flames and blazing hot fire. There he cried out in distress and grief.

source_sentence: 王即前問：『汝何以爾？』
translation: The king then went forward and asked, 'Why are you doing so?'

source_sentence: 人白王言：『我坐前時勸人十善，今受此苦，痛毒難忍。』
translation: The people said to the king, 'When I was sitting there, I encouraged people to do ten good deeds, but now that I'm suffering this pain, it's unbearable and painful.'

source_sentence: 王重答言：『何有是事？
translation: The king replied again, 'What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 勸人修善，反更受苦。』
translation: They encourage people to cultivate goodness and instead experience suffering.'

source_sentence: 又復問言：『勸行十善，令汝受苦；
translation: Again, [the Buddha] asked, “Encourage yourself to practice the ten good deeds so that you will experience suffering.

source_sentence: 前受勸人，行十善者，得善報不？』
translation: Does the person who was previously encouraged to perform the ten good deeds attain a good reward?'

source_sentence: 答言：『前人得善福耳，但教他故獨受此苦。』
translation: He replied, 'That person before me attained good fortune but taught others to suffer this pain alone.'

source_sentence: 王聞歡喜答言：『但令前人得善福者，甘心受苦，不以為恨。』
translation: When the king heard this, he rejoiced and replied, 'That person who causes someone before him to attain good fortune is willing to suffer pain but doesn't think it's a grudge.'

source_sentence: 魔聞是語，即隱形去。
translation: When Māra heard these words, he disappeared in hiding.

source_sentence: 遍行諸國，宣十善行，人民服化，慎身口意，正化彌布，一切欽崇。
translation: He traveled to various countries and preached the ten kinds of good deeds. The people were disciplined by him, being cautious in body, speech, and thought. His righteousness was widely propagated and revered by everyone.

source_sentence: 王德隆赫，嘉瑞而降，金輪先應，七寶具臻，遊化四域，導善為務。
translation: The king’s virtue prevailed and he was accompanied by an auspicious sign; the golden wheel preceded him. Endowed with the seven kinds of treasure, he traveled through the four quarters to edify the people in the four quarters, doing his duty being to lead and inspire those who were good.

source_sentence: 如是大王！
translation: So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 欲知爾時施陀尼彌王者，今現我父淨飯王是。
translation: I want to know that the king who gave it to King Dhāraṇī Mai of that time is now my father, King Śuddhodana.

source_sentence: 爾時母者，今現我母摩訶摩耶是。
translation: The mother of that time is now my mother Mahāmaudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 彼惠光王十善化民者，今我身是。
translation: That King of Wisdom and Light who transformed the people with the ten good qualities is now me.

source_sentence: 我緣彼世自行十善，又以勸民令行十善，是以今日得是足下千輻相輪。」
translation: Because I myself practiced the ten good qualities in that world and encouraged the people to practice the ten good qualities, today I've attained this thousand-spoked wheel beneath my feet.

source_sentence: 時洴沙王，復白佛言：「六師群迷，不自度量，貪著利養，生嫉妬心，
translation: The king of Kauśinagara then again said to the Buddha, “The six teachers are deluded and do not judge for themselves. They covet gain and become jealous with greed.

source_sentence: 求與世尊捔試神力，言佛作一，我當作二。
translation: He asked the Bhagavān to test his supernormal powers, saying that the Buddha would make one, and I would make two.

source_sentence: 佛現神變，妙難思議，六師窮縮，乃無一術，慚形愧影，投水而死，徒類散解，
translation: The Buddha manifested a marvelous and inconceivable apparition. All the six teachers were exhausted, but they did not know how to do anything. Embarrassed of their appearance and feeling shameful, they threw themselves into the water and died.

source_sentence: 自遺殃患。
translation: They left their own misfortune and trouble behind.

source_sentence: 念其迷惑，何劇之甚？」
translation: What's so serious about being confused?

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「不但今日，六師之徒，諍名利故，求與我決，自喪失眾；
translation: The Buddha said to the great king, “Today not only did the six teachers of the assembly seek fame and profit but also begged me to settle their disputes with them.

source_sentence: 過去世時，亦共我諍，我亦傷彼，奪其人眾。」
translation: In a past life, they shared my anger with me, and I also hurt them and snatched away their people.

source_sentence: 王即長跪，尋白佛言：「不審，世尊！
translation: The king knelt down and said to the Buddha, Not sure, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 過去世時，與六師鬪奪其徒眾，其事云何？
translation: In a past life, he fought with the six teachers and snatched away their followers. What happened to them?

source_sentence: 願具說示。」
translation: May I explain it in detail?

source_sentence: 婦語夫言：『汝興惡言，向於快士，方施油滓，無有淨心，所生之處，
translation: The woman said to her husband, “Through harsh words you should offer food and drink to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti in order to satisfy his desires. You have no pure mind and are born wherever you may be.

source_sentence: 當極醜惡，云何共汝作夫婦耶？』
translation: You'll be extremely ugly, so why would you become a husband and wife together?'

source_sentence: 夫復答言：『我常辛苦，積聚油具，云何獨施，不與我共？
translation: Again, he replied, 'I'm always suffering and accumulating oil containers, so why wouldn't you give them to me alone or share them with me?'

source_sentence: 終不聽汝要作夫婦。』
translation: I won't allow you to become a husband and wife after all.'

source_sentence: 妻復言曰：『若為汝妻，見汝形醜夜棄汝亡。』
translation: The wife again said, 'If I were to be your wife, I'd abandon you at night if I saw your ugly form.'

source_sentence: 夫答之言：『正使汝亡，我當逐汝，要得乃止。』
translation: The man answered, 'It's because you died, and I will chase you away; stop me if you can.'

source_sentence: 夫妻語竟，向辟支佛，身心自歸，欵誠悔過。
translation: After the couple had finished speaking, they faced the pratyekabuddha and returned to their own bodies and minds with pity and repentance.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛語油師夫妻：『緣汝施油，我病得差。
translation: The pratyekabuddha then said to the oilworkers and their husbands, 'Conditioned by you giving oil, my illness will be cured.

source_sentence: 今汝夫妻，欲求何願？
translation: What do you husband and wife wish for now?

source_sentence: 恣汝所求，悉當令得。』
translation: Whatever you ask for, you'll get it.'

source_sentence: 夫妻歡喜，長跪立願：『令我夫妻所生之處，天上人中，一切從意。』
translation: The couple rejoiced and knelt down long enough to make a vow, 'May I and my husband be born in heaven or among humans, all according to their wishes.'

source_sentence: 如是大王！
translation: So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 欲知爾時賣油人者，多羅睺施是。
translation: If you want to know that the oil seller at the time was a gift given by Tārāṇasī, then...

source_sentence: 是時油師婦者，多羅睺施婦是。
translation: The wife of the oil-worker at that time was the woman giving gifts to Tārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 緣於爾時見辟支佛，言似株杌手脚如軸，雖施油滓，瞋色與語，由是因緣，
translation: When he saw the pratyekabuddha at that time, he said, “It is like a pile of plants. My hands and feet are like a shaft. Although I offered oil to him, [he] became angry and gave me words because of this cause and condition.

source_sentence: 所生之處，初形甚醜，如前惡言；
translation: Where they are born their first form is ugly, just like the aforementioned bad words.

source_sentence: 緣後懺悔喜施好油，所生之處，還得端正。
translation: Conditioned by the latter repentance, he likes to give good oil and returns to his place of birth with proper appearance.

source_sentence: 緣以油施，常得多力，數千萬眾，無敢當者。
translation: As a condition, he gave oil to the monastery and always exerted great effort. There were tens of thousands of monks and nuns but none dared do so.

source_sentence: 福德報故，作轉輪王，食福四域，五欲從心，善惡之業，其報不朽。
translation: Because of the karmic retribution of merit, he becomes a wheel-turning king who feeds on the four fields of merit, follows the mind with the five desires, and does good and bad actions whose rewards won't perish.

source_sentence: 是故一切，當念道要，慎身口意，遵修道行。」
translation: Therefore, all of them should be mindful of the essentials of the path, be careful with body, speech, and thought, and cultivate their practice.

source_sentence: 佛說是時，洴沙王等，諸王臣民，四輩之眾，天龍鬼神，聞佛所說，有得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢者，
translation: When the Buddha had discoursed thus, the duly anointed khaṭṭṭika kings and other royal officials of the four groups of people, gods, dragons, and ghosts heard what the Buddha taught. Some of them attained stream-entry, some attain sakṛdāgāmin status, some non-returner status, and some arhat status.

source_sentence: 有種辟支佛善根本者，有發無上大道心者，或有遷住不退地者，一切歡喜，
translation: Those who plant the roots of goodness of the pratyekabuddhas, those who give rise to the determination for the unexcelled great path, and some who are established in the stage of nonregression—all rejoice.

source_sentence: 禮敬奉行。
translation: They paid homage and venerated him.
